snippet: The Greek debt deal opens the door to new uncertainties in Europe, which could once again revive the crisis atmosphere.
abstract: Greece's agreement to a set of tough austerity measures opens the door to new uncertainties in Europe, with the specter of crisis in the euro zone looming once again; many analysts say that similar measures in other debt-saddled countries, including Portugal and Ireland, could push those nations further into recession, drain the economies of their European trading partners, and do little to address the problems plaguing Europe's banks.

byline.original: By LIZ ALDERMAN and LANDON THOMAS Jr
byline.contributor: Liz Alderman reported from Paris and Landon Thomas Jr. from London. Jack Ewing contributed reporting from Frankfurt and Stephen Castle from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: The Greek debt deal opens the door to new uncertainties in Europe, which could once again revive the crisis atmosphere.

headline.seo: In Europe, Stagnation Is the New Normal
headline.main: In Europe, Stagnation as a Way of Life
headline.print_headline: In Europe, Stagnation as a Way of Life
